sentences.en: Children become fractious when they are tired.
sentences.cn: 小孩子累了就容易发脾气。

sentences.en: Children often get fractious and tearful when tired.
sentences.cn: 孩子们疲倦时易烦躁好哭。

sentences.en: Children often get fractious and tearful when tired.
sentences.cn: 孩子们疲倦时易怒好哭。

sentences.en: Fractious infighting left the cartel in disarray. Prices collapsed.
sentences.cn: 混战之后油价崩溃,欧佩克陷入困境.

sentences.en: He had worked with the diverse, fractious Iraqi opposition.
sentences.cn: 他曾经和不同的 、 易怒的伊拉克反对派一起工作.

sentences.en: It is still fractious, and in many places corrupt.
sentences.cn: 它仍然是四分五裂的, 而且在很多方面腐朽不堪.

sentences.en: Nancy was in a fractious mood.
Rockets were much too fractious to be tested near thickly populated areas.
sentences.cn: 在人口稠密地区附近,火箭太难驾驭,无法监测.

sentences.en: Run by fractious triumvirate, it produced some noble plays.
sentences.cn: 由独断专行的三人小组经营该剧团演出了一些名剧.

sentences.en: Things could get more fractious, though.
sentences.cn: 尽管如此,事态越发不受控制.

words.tran_cn: 易怒的；倔强的，难以对待的

trans.tran_en: someone who is fractious becomes angry very easily
